Economic costs from labor losses are currently at CHF 665 million per year and potentially higher under a high emissions scenario. The model includes uncertainty from climate simulations and variability in estimating losses. Analysis uses a spatially explicit approach with Monte Carlo simulation.

Potential tripling of economic costs from labor losses by the century's end under RCP8.5 scenario compared to current costs. Projected impact assumes no socio-economic changes, focusing on WBGT and labor sectors. Uncertainty analysis details are provided.
